Package nl.han.ica.yaeger.engine.entities.entity.sprites

Class UpdatableSpriteEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.han.ica.yaeger.engine.entities.entity.sprites.SpriteEntity
      • nl.han.ica.yaeger.engine.entities.entity.sprites.UpdatableSpriteEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bounded, Entity, NodeProvider, Removeable, SceneBoundaryCrosser, Updatable, Initializable, ResourceConsumer
    public abstract class UpdatableSpriteEntity
extends SpriteEntity
implements Updatable, SceneBoundaryCrosser
    An UpdatableSpriteEntity extends all behaviour of a SpriteEntity, but also implements the Updatable Interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UpdatableSpriteEntity

        public UpdatableSpriteEntity​(java.lang.String resource,
                             Position initialPosition,
                             Size size)
        Create a new SpriteEntity.
        Parameters:
        resource - The url of the image file. Relative to the resources folder.
        initialPosition - the initial Position of this Entity
        size - The bounding box of this SpriteEntity.

      • UpdatableSpriteEntity

        public UpdatableSpriteEntity​(java.lang.String resource,
                             Position initialPosition,
                             Size size,
                             int frames)
        Create a new SpriteEntity.
        Parameters:
        resource - The url of the image file. Relative to the resources folder.
        initialPosition - the initial Position of this Entity
        size - The bounding box of this SpriteEntity.
        frames - The number of frames this Image contains. By default the first frame is loaded.

      • UpdatableSpriteEntity

        public UpdatableSpriteEntity​(java.lang.String resource,
                             Position initialPosition,
                             Size size,
                             int frames,
                             Movement initialMovement)
        Create a new UpdatableSpriteEntity.
        Parameters:
        resource - The url of the image file. Relative to the resources folder.
        initialPosition - the initial Position of this Entity
        size - The bounding box of this SpriteEntity.
        frames - The number of frames this Image contains. By default the first frame is loaded.
        initialMovement - The movement of this UpdatableSpriteEntity

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update​(long timestamp)
        Description copied from interface: Updatable
        The update() method is called each frame.

        Use this method to init frame-based behaviour to the game-object.

        Specified by:
        update in interface Updatable
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the timestamp of the update

      • changeSpeed

        protected void changeSpeed​(double change)
        Change the speed at which this UpdatableSpriteEntity should move. Using this method will increase or decrease the current speed. If it is required to set the speed to a specific value, use the method setSpeed.
        Parameters:
        change - A value large than 1 will mean an increment in speed. A value between 0 and 1 will mean a decrement in speed.

      • setAutoCycle

        protected void setAutoCycle​(long interval)
        Set the interval at which the sprite should be automatically cycled
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval milli-seconds

      • init

        public void init​(com.google.inject.Injector injector)
        Specified by:
        init in interface Initializable
        Overrides:
        init in class SpriteEntity
        Parameters:
        injector - the Injector used for Dependency Injection

      • setSpeed

        protected void setSpeed​(double newSpeed)
        Set the speed with which this UpdatableSpriteEntity moves.
        Parameters:
        newSpeed - the speed

      • setDirection

        protected void setDirection​(double newDirection)
        Set the Movement.Direction in which this UpdatableSpriteEntity should move. This value is in degrees, where
        • 0 means up
        • 90 means to the right
        • 180 means down
        • 270 to the left

        Parameters:
        newDirection - the direction in degrees

      • setSceneBoundaryCrossingDelegateFactory

        @Inject
public void setSceneBoundaryCrossingDelegateFactory​(SceneBoundaryCrossingDelegateFactory sceneBoundaryCrossingDelegateFactory)
